dt: {bc}of little or less importance, value, or {d_link|merit|merit:1}

dt.t: always felt {wi}inferior{/wi} to his older brother

dt: {bc}of low or lower degree or rank
{bc}situated below another and especially another similar {d_link|superior|superior:1} part of an upright body
{bc}situated in a relatively low {d_link|posterior|posterior:1} or {d_link|ventral|ventral:1} position in a quadrupedal body
{bc}situated below another plant part or organ

quotes.t: No longer do workers and peasants feel {qword}inferior{/qword} to the university-trained.
Sharks, rays, and ratfishes share a special burden: these cartilaginous fishes are saddled with a reputation for being somehow {qword}inferior{/qword} to vertebrates blessed with bony skeletons.
… the pearls were of {qword}inferior{/qword} quality; they looked like pearlized globs of varying wrinkly shapes.

et: Middle English, from Latin, comparative of {it}inferus{/it} lower {ma}{mat|under|}{/ma}
shortdef: of little or less importance, value, or merit
of low or lower degree or rank
